intro: Cyanella alba subsp. minor, commonly known as the white-flowered cyanella, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
